questions.question: Sophia ………………… she was feeling better.
questions.description: That can be left out after common reporting verbs like say, think and suggest.

questions.question: I …………………….. she was lying.
questions.description: That can be left out after common reporting verbs like say, think and suggest.

questions.question: The doctor ………………………… I should take a holiday.
questions.description: That can be left out after common reporting verbs like say, think and suggest.

questions.question: She ………………………… she was not coming.
questions.description: That cannot be dropped after reply, telegraph or shout.

questions.question: She …………………………. she was busy.
questions.description: That cannot be dropped after shout.

questions.question: The judge paid no attention to the ……………………………. she was unhappy at home.
questions.description: That cannot be dropped after nouns.

questions.question: She disagreed with my ………………………….. education should be free for all.
questions.description: That cannot be dropped after a noun.

questions.question: Come in quietly ……………………….. the baby does not wake up.
questions.description: That can be dropped after so that, such ….that.

questions.question: You can borrow my car …………………….. you bring it back tomorrow.
questions.description: That can be dropped after provided.

questions.question: She is the woman ………………………. met in Mumbai.
questions.description: When the relative pronoun is the object in a relative clause, it can be dropped out.

questions.question: This is the house ………………………….. am thinking about buying.
questions.description: When the relative pronoun is the object in a relative clause, it can be dropped out.
